attributes.action: Government plans to share NHS patient details with private sector
attributes.additional_details:
The Government has plans to share (share implies a two way exchange to contribute which this is not) our private medical records to private life science companies under the illusion of furthering medical science.
I do not want private medical records in part or in whole handed over to company’s outside of Government control. The public will have no say as to how our data will be secured, handled, further disclosed to outside parties of these private life science firms and other records that will be generated containing our private data and we can not trust the Government as data controller to protect our rights in this matter.
If you agree please sign the e-petition:
We the undersigned  ask that the Government halt plans to share private data with the objective of guaranteeing that no personal or accessible data record either in part or in whole shall be disclosed, shared, sold or provided in electronic, paper, digital or any other format to non-governmental entities.

rejection.details: Against auto opt-in sharing of NHS medical records
